dt: {bc}an Old World bitter perennial mint ({it}Marrubium vulgare{/it}) with downy leaves
{bc}an extract or confection made from the dried leaves and flowering tops of this plant
{bc}any of several mints resembling the horehound

et: Middle English {it}horhoune{/it}, from Old English {it}hārhūne{/it}, from {it}hār{/it} hoary + {it}hūne{/it} horehound {ma}{mat|hoar|}{/ma}
shortdef: an Old World bitter perennial mint (Marrubium vulgare) with downy leaves
an extract or confection made from the dried leaves and flowering tops of this plant
any of several mints resembling the horehound
